locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explores the 'minor prophets', the concept of theodicy in Habakkuk, and the tension between the 'Monday-morning side of resurrection' and the grim realities of racial injustice and personal exhaustion.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-contextual awareness regarding the Minor Prophets and the theological definition of theodicy.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting theological truths and historical facts, shifting toward the end into a communal petition (Expressive/Directive) and a concluding promise (Commissive).
voorbeelden: I take that 'make known' to be elliptical.
The just shall live by faith.
O Lord, revive thy work!

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from despair over current 'bad news' to a state of hopeful persistence through prayer.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is the implied agent of the 'revival' requested, though not explicitly named as the perlocutionary agent.

voorbeelden: Habakkuk deals with what the theologians call theodicy.
We have seen truth incarnate.
Sixty percent of our black children are born out of wedlock.
Call him.
Ask him to help.
Let all the earth keep silence.
I never like to keep things on a broad scale.
I apologize to Senator Moynihan.
Thanks be to God!
He will give his angels charge over you.
The Lord shall renew their strength.
He will be all and all.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but delayed; the promises are used as a climax rather than the structural foundation.

voorbeelden: I take that 'make known' to be elliptical.
Thanks be to God, the 'no' got wiped out.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low; the preacher acts more as a witness/intercessor than a sacramental officer pronouncing reality.

indicatoren: Lengthy introduction on the definition of 'minor prophets'.
Detailed sociological statistics from Bill Moyers.
Historical anecdotes about Clarence Darrow and Bernie Resnick.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer of the 'bad news' for the majority of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct address of God's promise to the specific congregation in the 2nd person.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of the sermon is deferred to the final few paragraphs.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High emotional resonance, though largely based on future-tense biblical quotes.
voorbeelden: He will give his angels charge over you to keep you in all your ways.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address regarding the 'middle years' and the call to prayer.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the struggle of Habakkuk to the listener's life.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Habakkuk, history, and social statistics.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the first half.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Old Testament history and 20th-century civil rights history.

actueel_present.gebruik: The concluding call to prayer and the 'now' of the struggle.

voorbeelden: 70 percent of our children will be in single-parent families. How we do need to pray...
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative to pray is grounded in a crisis rather than a specific promise of God's presence.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Resurrection) -> Commissive (He will give angels charge) -> Directive (Call him).
voorbeelden: He will give his angels charge over you... Call him, ask him to help.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Effective in the final movement of the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Thanks be to God that they that so cry have the assurance... Call him.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: It is a major crisis... How we do need to pray.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a bridge between a lecture on theodicy and a pastoral encouragement to pray amidst social and personal decay.

sterke_punten.effect: Provides a powerful cognitive framework for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the definition of 'Minor Prophets'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops 'talking about' Habakkuk and starts 'praying with' the congregation.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'I pronounce' declarative authority, opting for the 'We should ask' directive.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the promises quoted, but the preacher speaks 'about' God more than 'for' God.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a fellow-traveler and witness.
tekstueel_bewijs: I take that 'make known' to be...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low; the Spirit is mentioned once near the end.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is sought through the preacher's emotional appeal and biblical quotes.
tekstueel_bewijs: One day, his word, his spirit, will cover the earth.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a source of encouragement (paraclesis) rather than a creative word that effects what it says.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Limited to the final poetic section.
tekstueel_bewijs: Stand by me; stand by me.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Habakkuk deals with what the theologians call theodicy.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God answers your 'Why?' with His presence.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a definition to an encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often quoted as a general biblical truth rather than a direct address.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 2nd person singular to apply the promise of strength.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are bruised and bleeding, the Lord says: I will renew your strength.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Increase 'You' (the hearer) in the middle section.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are in the middle years right now.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The call to pray is sometimes a response to the 'bad news' rather than God's 'Yes'.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the prayer in the finished work of Christ more explicitly.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply moving homily that successfully transitions from the head to the heart, though it carries a heavy load of informative 'talking about' before reaching the performative 'event'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about hope, but attempting to 'enact' hope through the Commissive force of the Word.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically powerful (pathos), the SAT analysis shows the sermon's sacramental weakness lies in its lack of Declarative verbs.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'crisis of the black family' section functions as a 'Directive-trigger' that risks moralism if not immediately met by a 'Commissive' promise.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The just shall live by faith.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - serves as the recurring 'refrain' of the event.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'preacher as storyteller' persona, which increases locutionary interest but can dilute illocutionary directness.
